com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel

Class Span

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel.Span

  • public class Span
extends Object
    Object that encapsulates a span over text.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_TOKENS

        public static final int NO_TOKENS
        Special value to represent the fact that a span has 0 tokens.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NOT_A_TOKEN_OFFSET

        public static final int NOT_A_TOKEN_OFFSET
        Special value to represent an invalid offset. This means that someone has computed the offset and determined that it is not on a token boundary. The offset is either in the middle of a token, or in the middle of the span between two tokens. This has a different meaning than TOKEN_OFFSET_NOT_COMPUTED, which means that nobody attempted to compute the offset yet.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TOKEN_OFFSET_NOT_COMPUTED

        public static final int TOKEN_OFFSET_NOT_COMPUTED
        Special value used in the constructor to reflect the fact that nobody attempted to compute the token offset. Distinct from NOT_A_TOKEN_OFFSET
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(Text docText,
                 int begin,
                 int end)
        Initializes the Span object over the text field of the input tuple.
        Parameters:
        docText - the Text object this span is based on
        begin - begin offset of the span
        end - end offset of the span
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the begin offset is greater than the end offset, or the begin or end offsets are negative values
        RuntimeException - if the input type is not a span

      • reallyInit

        protected void reallyInit(int begin,
                          int end)
        Initialize the Span object without performing any validation checks.
        Parameters:
        begin - begin offset of the span
        end - end offset of the span

        public String getText()
        This method returns the textual content of this span.
        Returns:

      • getIsDerived

        public boolean getIsDerived()
        Returns true if this span is over text that is derived from another source.
        Returns:
        true if this span is over text that is derived from another source, with offset remapping available via makeRemappedSpan(Span)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(SpanText other)
        Compare two Span objects, according to the following list of rules. These rules are examined in the given order, and first unequal result is returned.
        • A null object is ordered lower than other objects.
        • The objects are compared by the order of their docText objects.
        • The objects are compared by the order of their begin offsets.
        • The objects are compared by the order of their end offsets.
        Parameters:
        other - the span to be compared against the current span
        Returns:
        1 if the current span sorts higher than the input span, -1 if the input span sorts higher than the current span, 0 if they are equal

      • makeBaseSpan

        public static Span makeBaseSpan(Span src,
                                int begin,
                                int end)
        Make a span over the original document, as opposed to a span within another span.
        Parameters:
        src - span over the same text you want to create a span over
        begin - offset into the *document* text
        end - offset into the *document* text
        Returns:
        a new span over the given input span

      • makeBaseSpan

        public static Span makeBaseSpan(Text src,
                                int begin,
                                int end)
        Make a span over a text object
        Parameters:
        src - span over the same text you want to create a span over
        begin - offset into the *document* text
        end - offset into the *document* text
        Returns:
        a new span over the given input span

      • makeSubSpan

        public static Span makeSubSpan(Span src,
                               int begin,
                               int end)
        Make a span over another span. The new span must be completely contained within the original span.
        Parameters:
        src - span over the same text you want to create a span over
        begin - offset into the source span's text
        end - offset into the source span's text
        Returns:
        a new span over the given input span

      • makeRemappedSpan

        public static Span makeRemappedSpan(Span derivedSpan)
        Create a new span by remapping the offsets of a span over a derived string back to the original string.
        Parameters:
        derivedSpan - span over a string that was derived by performing some transformation (HTML detag, substring, etc.) over a string
        Returns:
        a new span over the original source (original HTML, full string, etc.) of the string that derivedSpan references

      • makeSpan

        public static Span makeSpan(Text docText,
                            int begin,
                            int end)
        Factory method for creating Span objects.
        Parameters:
        docText - the document text object on which this span is based on.
        begin - begin offset within the base text where the span should begin
        end - end offset
        Returns:
        a newly constructed span

      • overlaps

        public static boolean overlaps(Span span1,
                               Span span2)
        Returns true if the given spans overlap. Spans with unequal docText are considered non-overlapping
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether the given spans overlap

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Span otherSpan)
        Returns true if this span contains the other span. Spans with unequal docText do not contain each other.
        Parameters:
        otherSpan - The other span to be compared with this span.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether this span contains the other span

      • chomp

        public Span chomp()
        Removes any leading or trailing whitespace from this span. Analogous to StringUtils#chomp(CharSequence).
        Returns:
        a span contained within this span, with no leading or trailing whitespace

      • makeSubSpan

        public static Span makeSubSpan(SpanText inputSpan,
                               int begin,
                               int end)

      • toText

        public Text toText()
        Generate a text object from this span object. The object is cached for reuse. The reference to docTextObj will be lost.
        Returns:
        generated text object from this span

      • convert

        public static Span convert(Object source)
        Convert a text object to a span object. If the input is already a span, return it. For all other objects a type cast exception will be thrown. Use it only when you know the input is either Text or Span.
        If the input to this method is null, return null.
        Parameters:
        source - String, Span, or Text object to be converted to a span
        Returns:
        Span object converted from source
